alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:31AM EST until December 19 at 3:59AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Vermont, including the following counties, Addison, Orange and Washington. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring, including the Dog River. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from rainfall and snowmelt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Montpelier, Moretown, Northfield, Northfield Village, Waitsfield, Berlin, Waterbury Village, Roxbury, Middlesex, E F Knapp State Airport, Duxbury, Fayston, Warren, Waterbury, Williamstown, Brookfield, East Montpelier, Northfield Falls, Riverton and West Berlin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
